questions.question: What is time period of an oscillator?

answers.a: Time taken to complete one half of an oscillation
answers.b: Time taken to complete one complete oscillation
answers.c: Time taken to reach from one end to other end of oscillation
answers.d: Time taken to complete one third of an oscillation

explanations.b: Time period of an oscillator is the time taken to complete one complete oscillation which means the oscillator reaches back to its original position after one time period.

questions.question: How long will a geometry optimization continue to run?

answers.b: Till it achieves a threshold predicted change in energy
answers.c: Till it reaches a maximum number of steps before the threshold predicted change in energy

explanations.d: The geometry optimization calculation will continue to run till it reaches the stationary state of the molecule, this is confirmed by calculating the predicted change in the energy between current and next step. Often the stationary point is not reached in the default number of steps due to a much diverse potential energy surface and the geometry optimization stops after it runs for the maximum number of steps.

questions.question: Which of the following is true for an optimized minimum energy structure?

answers.a: It will have all positive valued frequencies of normal modes
answers.b: It will be the global minima on the potential energy surface
answers.c: There can be small negative valued frequencies too
answers.d: Re-optimizing an optimized geometry will produce a new geometry

explanations.a: A minimum energy stationary point on the potential energy surface is characterised by its frequencies of its vibrational modes. A minimum will have all positive valued frequencies.

questions.question: Geometry optimization of an excited stationary state will take it to any of the minimum energy stationary states.

explanations.a: Geometry optimization by default takes a structure to a minimum stationary state unless otherwise mentioned.
